newsitem.title: UK: France's Superphenix fast-breeder reactor restarts.
newsitem.headline: France's Superphenix fast-breeder reactor restarts.

text.p: France's protoype Superphenix fast-breeder nuclear reactor has been restarted after a 12-day shutdown for repairs, nuclear industry news agency NucNet said on Monday.
NucNet reported plant operators NERSA as saying the repairs had been made to a sodium circulation pump.
The reactor was stopped on November 6 to replace a faulty bearing which had been causing vibrations on one of four primary pumps. The bearing acts as a drive shaft between the motor and the pump.
The 60 billion franc reactor has been dogged by problems since ite was commissioned 20 years ago and has operated for only a dozen months.

The plant currently operates as a research and development site looking into the recycling of nuclear waste, well short of its original design as a fast breeder producing more plutonium than it burns when generating electricity.
